formattedAddress: 147 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 147 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009-4946, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug neighborhood counter-serve turning out square & round pizza by the slice or pie.

originalText.text: Pizza is really good. Like REALLY good. I ate these 3 slices and the vodka was great and crispy and creamy. The meat lover one was not greasy somehow, and it had amazing spices and flavors from the sausage and the pepperoni. Was honestly the best one and the buffalo chicken one had the right amount of kick and was. Another great slice. Worth it. Crispy bottoms, no floppy sloppy droopy pizza and great flavor.

text.text: Pizza is really good. Like REALLY good. I ate these 3 slices and the vodka was great and crispy and creamy. The meat lover one was not greasy somehow, and it had amazing spices and flavors from the sausage and the pepperoni. Was honestly the best one and the buffalo chicken one had the right amount of kick and was. Another great slice. Worth it. Crispy bottoms, no floppy sloppy droopy pizza and great flavor.

originalText.text:
One of the hardest things I ever had to do was break up with East Village Pizza. I'll spare you the novel, but I couldn't justify paying $6.25 for a single slice of thin crust pepperoni pizza that would just wake my stomach up and leave me hungrier than before.

After taking a few months to heal, I was finally ready to get back on the horse and find a new late night pizza spot to hit after striking out at the local bars.

On Saturday, after striking out at the local bars, my buddy mentioned this place and that it was a good Prince Street Pizza comparable. We walked in here and were met with a small line and not one, but two, neon signs. I love a good neon sign.

The staff is LOCKED in and are running this thing like a finely tuned machine. I opted to get two slices of the thick square pizza, with the cute little slightly charred pepperonis on top hehe. $11.98 total for two thick slices. HUGE.

I think this may be better than Prince Street, but if it's not, it's 1a/1b. The crust is perfectly crisped, and those pepperonis are a gift from god. True artistry.

After demolishing the first slice, I was like "Damn I lowkey could have been good with just one slice..." I think I am still a bit scarred from the East Village Pizza relationship.

I have found my new late night pizza spot. I want to leave you, my dear reader, with a quote from Marilyn Monroe:

"Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together."

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

originalText.text: A hole in the wall pizza shop with great pizza. Yes just go try it. After I ordered, I saw the articles posted on the wall about the popular pepperoni slice but I got others. The display shows mostly square slices - if you want a round slice they are behind the counter.  STANDING room only.

text.text: A hole in the wall pizza shop with great pizza. Yes just go try it. After I ordered, I saw the articles posted on the wall about the popular pepperoni slice but I got others. The display shows mostly square slices - if you want a round slice they are behind the counter.  STANDING room only.

originalText.text: Loved the use of the cupping pepperoni which were nice and crispy, but what really stood out to me was just how delicious the dough and bread was on the pizza! Very flavorful and has this amazing crunch to it.

text.text: Loved the use of the cupping pepperoni which were nice and crispy, but what really stood out to me was just how delicious the dough and bread was on the pizza! Very flavorful and has this amazing crunch to it.

originalText.text:
One of the best sicilian style pizza I have had! The sauce is so flavored along with a perfectly crunchy base. The pizza is not too at all greasy or oily. They have variety of veggie and non vegetarian options to choose from.
You can stand inside along the narrow counter to eat. The service was quick!
